title.justification: This is the title of the paper.

extractions.description: This paper proposes a novel learning framework called Generative Augmented Flow Networks (GAFlowNets) to incorporate intermediate rewards into Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets). The approach aims to improve exploration in environments with sparse rewards through intrinsic motivation and demonstrates its effectiveness through extensive experiments on the GridWorld task and a molecule generation domain.

type.justification: The paper focuses on proposing a new model and verifying its effectiveness using extensive experiments.
type.quote: Based on extensive experiments on the GridWorld task, we demonstrate the effectiveness and efficiency of GAFlowNet in terms of convergence, performance, and diversity of solutions. We further show that GAFlowNet is scalable to a more complex and large-scale molecule generation domain, where it achieves consistent and significant performance improvement.

name.justification: The paper builds on and extends Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets), which are based on reinforcement learning paradigms, to incorporate intermediate rewards.
name.quote: Inspired by this, we propose Generative Augmented Flow Networks (GAFlowNets), a novel learning framework to incorporate intermediate rewards into GFlowNets.

name.justification: The paper focuses on Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets), which are a type of generative model.
name.quote: The Generative Flow Network (Bengio et al., 2021b, GFlowNet) is a probabilistic framework where an agent learns a stochastic policy for object generation, such that the probability of generating an object is proportional to a given reward function.

name.justification: The proposed GAFlowNets rely on intrinsic motivation mechanisms to provide intermediate rewards for improved exploration.
name.quote: We specify intermediate rewards by intrinsic motivation to tackle the exploration problem in sparse reward environments.

name.justification: The paper proposes GAFlowNets as a novel extension of GFlowNets (Generative Flow Networks).
name.quote: Inspired by this, we propose Generative Augmented Flow Networks (GAFlowNets), a novel learning framework to incorporate intermediate rewards into GFlowNets.

is_contributed.justification: GAFlowNets are the primary contribution of the paper.
is_contributed.quote: In this paper, we propose a new learning framework, GAFlowNet, for GFlowNet to incorporate intermediate rewards.

is_executed.justification: The model was tested using various tasks, including GridWorld and molecule generation.
is_executed.quote: Based on extensive experiments on the GridWorld task, we demonstrate the effectiveness and efficiency of GAFlowNet... We further show that GAFlowNet is scalable to a more complex and large-scale molecule generation domain.

is_compared.justification: The model's performance is compared with several baselines, including GFlowNet, MCMC, PPO, and PPO-RND.
is_compared.quote: We compare GAFlowNet against strong baselines including Metropolis-Hastings-MCMC (Dai et al., 2020), PPO (Schulman et al., 2017), and a GFlowNet (Malkin et al., 2022).

referenced_paper_title.justification: The proposed model GAFlowNet is a novel contribution introduced in this paper itself and does not have a reference paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Our method also general, being applicable to different types of GFlowNets.

name.justification: The paper discusses the original GFlowNet and compares it with the proposed GAFlowNet.
name.quote: The Generative Flow Network (Bengio et al., 2021b, GFlowNet) is a probabilistic framework where an agent learns a stochastic policy for object generation, such that the probability of generating an object is proportional to a given reward function.

is_contributed.justification: The original GFlowNet is not a contribution of this paper but is discussed and used for comparison.
is_contributed.quote: The Generative Flow Network (Bengio et al., 2021b, GFlowNet) is a probabilistic framework where an agent learns a stochastic policy for object generation, such that the probability of generating an object is proportional to a given reward function.

is_executed.justification: The paper focuses on GAFlowNet and only discusses GFlowNet theoretically.
is_executed.quote: We compare GAFlowNet against strong baselines including... and a GFlowNet (Malkin et al., 2022).

is_compared.justification: GFlowNet is compared against GAFlowNet to highlight the improvements in exploration and task performance.
is_compared.quote: As shown, GFlowNets can get trapped in a few modes, while GAFlowNet is able to discover all of the modes efficiently.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The original GFlowNet model is referenced from previous works as a comparison baseline.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The Generative Flow Network (Bengio et al., 2021b, GFlowNet) is a probabilistic framework where an agent learns a stochastic policy for object generation, such that the probability of generating an object is proportional to a given reward function.
